results.title: The role of metformin as a treatment for neuropsychiatric illness.
results.text_hl: The role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a treatment for @<m>DISEASE_Pediatric_acute_onset_neuropsychiatric_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C000631768 @@@neuropsychiatric illness@@@.

results.title: Behavioral Test Scores Could Be Linked to the Protein Expression Values of p62 and GLAST in the Brains of Mice with Neuropsychiatric Disorder-Related Behaviors.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, a therapeutic study was conducted on these @DISEASE_Mental_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@neuropsychiatric disorder@@@ model @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ using @CHEMICAL_Butyric_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020148 @@@butyric acid@@@, @CHEMICAL_polydatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C058229 @@@piceid@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@. It was found that some molecules could effectively improve the behavioral scores of @<m>DISEASE_Pediatric_acute_onset_neuropsychiatric_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C000631768 @@@neuropsychiatric@@@ model @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

results.title: Metformin treatment reduces motor and neuropsychiatric phenotypes in the zQ175 mouse model of Huntington disease
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment reduces motor and @<m>DISEASE_Pediatric_acute_onset_neuropsychiatric_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C000631768 @@@neuropsychiatric@@@ phenotypes in the zQ175 @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @DISEASE_Huntington_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D006816 @@@Huntington disease@@@
